intro: Platycarpum schultesii, commonly known as the Schultesi's flat-fruit, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Platycarpum schultesii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
